detaileddescription.para: Magic number used to determine if the library has been initialized.
The maximum size of an error message generated by the OS.
The error message used when an error is not resolved.
Warnings that could likely be ignored.
Defines the available levels (severity/priority) of logging output.
Use the default for this type of destination.
Do not include time stamps in output.
Do not include the human-readable logging level in output.
Do not include the process/app name in output.

Don't include milliseconds in time stamps. If not set, time stamps in output to this destination will be appended with the current millisecond in addition to the hour, minute, and second. If SIRO_NOTIME is set, this has no effect.
Don't write header messages when logging begins, or the file is rolled. Only applicable to log files.
Includes all other options; effectively disables all output formatting except the original formatted message (does not include SIRO_NOHDR; set that flag in addition to remove header messages).
If set, the foreground color is 'intensified'.
Available styles (colors, brightness) for console output.
Used to differentiate between a single sir_level and one or more bitwise OR'd together.
Used to differentiate between a single sir_option and one or more bitwise OR'd together.
The underlying type used for characters in output.
The value used to represent an invalid file identifier.
The value that represents the success condition.
